choices: It's your spouse's birthday next week!
It's the day you have to take Aunty May's dog for a walk!
It's the day the diner down the road has an all you can eat offer!
1.content: You know that something important is about to happen, but you're not quite sure what. You wrack your brains, and finally, you come up with the answer, it's ...
1.title: What is about to happen?

choices: a surprise party!
a romantic dinner
a night at the movies
11.content:
It's your spouse's birthday next week! Ugh, nothing like waiting until the last minute, right?

Wracking your brain, you think of the possibilities. A grand gesture would sure to be well-received, though you know your spouse hasn't specifically asked for anything. Too many decisions! Better make some tea to calm yourself and think this through.

Ah, that's better!

First things first, how should you celebrate?
11.title: Party Time!

choices: what kind of theme party
this is getting out of hand
foods of choice
111.content:
Sipping on my cup of tea I try to make a list of people that we both know. Well we know a lot of people but not close connections. Okay there are about four couples form the work place so I will call them. I seem to be talking to myself so I can turn off the thousand and one things going through my head. Once I know I had a list, one has to be sure that everyone is available.

I pick up the phone and start calling, then head to the computer to send emails. Funny thing is some people won't reply to the phone calls. This new Technology we have now seems to have taken away from the personable connections.

While I wait for the responses I decided to hit up pintrest and get some ideas for a theme party. I don't want it to be too much but a little effort wouldn't hurt.
111.title: a surprise party!

choices: If I agree for a transfer to Never-Never Land, I'll get a big promotion.
I'm allergic to woollen blankets.
My friends have planned a bowling night and I'm designated driver.
112.content:
Well last year was the big 3-0 surprise party so there's really no need for another blow out. A family dinner would be nice but then again trying to wrangle everyone together last minute could be a headache to say the least. So you decide on a romantic dinner for two. You cooking, a quiet evening at home, candles, wine. YES! This would be perfect.

Browsing through the crowded isles at FOODLAND getting necessities for the birthday feast your mind starts to wander to the big night. This night is going to be just what the doctor ordered you think wistfully. After 5 years of marital bliss you were happy but lately things had been a little strained. You had sensed things just weren't right lately but chalked it up to the impending birthday. Another year gone by can throw anyone off a little. God knows you always got a little crazed when your birthday rolled around. Heading to the checkout you feel yourself cheer up a little as you leave you thoughts and re-enter reality. Everything would be fine.

6 o'clock had seemed to creep up on you without warning and found yourself frantically running around the kitchen finishing everything up. Everything had to be ready to go before your beloved came home. There's nothing worse than a badly prepared birthday offering and you intend for everything to go smoothly.

At 6.30 the front door opens and you're thankful for that bit of extra time. You'd had just enough time to light the last candle and chuck that old lady floral apron out of sight to reveal what your spouse just loves to see you wearing.

You're waiting with a smile as your spouse enters the kitchen. Genuine surprise! Hadn't a clue! Success! you think.

Happy Birthday baby. You move nearer for a kiss but before you can get too close your spouse steps back avoiding your eyes. Not the reaction you expected. What is it?

I know this probably isn't the best time but we need to talk..
112.title: A Romantic Dinner

choices: Plan our vacation this summer.
Talk about you. Tell me how YOU are.
1122.content:
Your spouse answers somberly, their lips pressed tightly together to hide a smile.
It takes a moment for that to sink in, but when it does, you laugh and hit their arm playfully. "You scared me." You smile.
"Always the tone of surprise. I believe you were about to kiss me?"
You kiss them quickly before taking their hand and leading them to the table.
"How was work, love?" Your spouse asks over your favorite meal.
"Work was work. But let's not talk about that. Let's..."
1122.title: I'm allergic to woollen blankets.

choices: You hit a dead end as no decent movies are playing
There are many choices in the movie listings and you get a bit overwhelmed
The newspaper is out-of-date, so you go online to check out current movies
113.content:
It's too late for a surprise party and cash has been a little tight lately, so a trip to the fancy steakhouse down the street is out.

While gulping hot tea, you look around the room. Movie posters of Spiderman and The Matrix grace the walls. Packaged action figures crowd a shelf in one corner of the room. Weapon replicas from Kill Bill, The Lord of the Rings, and Star Wars reside in a place of honor above the television.

Smiling, you reach for the newspaper. What are the new coming attractions and do they fit your spouse's idea of a good time?
113.title: a night at the movies

choices: Theater hotdogs and chewy pretzels, mmmm
Got to get the romantic in, private dinner at home?
Pick a decent restaurant, if you're lucky, they'll have a 2 for 1 deal.
1133.content:
Aw, score!

The new Captain America is playing in the dollar theater. Sure, it's not glamorous but you know your mate is as into the action flicks as you. That's one of the many reasons why the two of you are in it for the long haul.

Finding something you'll both enjoy in the dollar theater is like an extra bonus or something. Now you can splurge a bit and do something special for dinner.
1133.title: The newspaper is out-of-date, so you go online ...

choices: Wake up her old bones to ask her
Let her sleep and come back tomorrow
Go home cuz you think you feel a cold coming on
12.content:
So you jump on your trusty motor-scooter and ride to Aunt May's. She's glad to see you, but not as glad as her dog is. Aunty May has been sick for three days, and poor Grover can't wait to get outside!

Grover jumps on you as soon as you enter the door. Aunt May barely gets a chance to say hi before Grover is out the door like a white streak of fur. As you race after him, you figure you don't need the leash today, anyway.

Two hours later you return to Aunty's house worn out, and she's been waiting for you. "There you are! I've been dying to ask you, what are you doing for you know whose birthday?"

"Whose birthday?" you ask, feeling confused.

"You know, silly child!" Aunt May laughs like you weren't serious. "Will you get me a cup of tea, please? I feel like I haven't had one in a week!"

Feeling guilty, since it's been a week since you were last there, you go to the kitchen to put on the kettle. It takes a while to find her tea, and when you get back to her, she's fallen asleep.

Now you're dying of curiosity. Who was Aunty talking about?

Should you...
12.title: At Aunty May's

choices: You wake up at 8:00 and try to call her
You wake up the next morning to your phone ringin
In the middle of the night you realize what Aunt May was talking about
123.content:
You make sure that Aunt May's kettle is shut off and the water is poured out. You make sure Grover has food and water. You play with him a bit, then leave,locking the door behind you. As you get into your car, you realize that you didn't leave Aunt May a note. You promise to call her after dinner.

         After you arrive home, your body is aching all over. You don't feel well. Instead of cooking a big dinner, like you planned, you cook some Mrs. Grass's Chicken soup and make yourself a tuna sandwich. Your throat hurts when you swallow. Eating the sandwich was excruciating. After youeat your meal, you go to bed, completely forgetting about Aunt May.
123.title: Go home cuz you think you feel a cold coming on

choices: your friends taking your snapshots as a memoir for...
your mate with the camera commemorating the event
your mate asks you what your real present is
You find out it is your mate's b'day.
13.content:
Without a doubt, your turbulent cooking has left its marks on your mate's stomach. So much so that your mate doesn't let you enter the kitchen anymore. Now this diner down the road is offering a simple harvest of its goodies; would your mate like to come with you?

You decide to ask and see what that picky spouse of yours will have to say.

As soon as you finish the offer to dine down the road, that pair of gorgeous emerald eyes shine brightly. "You remembered?"

Suddenly you panic. 'What? What does my one and only mean? What was I to remember?' Also, you wonder why your mate is showering you with caresses, and you know for sure this is not a drunken stupor on both sides.

At the diner, you eat slowly, transfixed like all married couples, tasting the food, wondering, and trying to feel the thing you supposedly discovered beneath your mate's sudden delight.

What is it? Someone clicks the shutter of a camera somewhere and you look to see...
13.title: the diner down the road

choices: You gasp and the food fight begins
The other couples stare at you two
You get up and leave
133.content:
...that Mrs Dough, one of your neighbors takes a picture of you two.

"Don't they look so perfect together?" She asks the rest.

The others agree and give compliments suddenly making the two of you feel special.

"I'm going to enlarge this picture, frame it and give it to you." Mrs Dough faced you and your spouse.

Present? If she had to give us a present why did she tell us what it's going to be? Dumb old woman. You never liked her from the very beginning you got into the neighborhood.

"So what's the real present, honey?" Your mate asks, his eyes twinkling in elation.

Still such a kid, you think. A present without any reason for it.

"When will you grow up?" You whisper to him.

"I get it that this dinner was my present but hon, you're full of surprises. I'm sure there's more."

Your temper gets the most of you making your face grow beet red. "I'm really tired of this. You don't expect me to use my money to buy you presents for nothing..."

He lifts his glass of juice to take a sip as you continue talking in a low tone and start using gestures when you accidentally hit his glass pouring apple juice on his pants. For a moment you freeze.

"Oh so now you do this to me because you're angry I asked for a present?"

He grabs your plate of food and drops its contents on you lap.
133.title: your mate asks you what your real present is

1331.content:
Your mouth drops open and you look at your spouse. "That was an accident." You say slowly.
"Yeah, I'm sure it was." Your spouse gives you a semi-playful smile.
You return an evil smirk of your own and toss the contents of your cup at them.
People are staring, but the two of you shameless throw food at each other.
You realize your mistake in the middle of the throwing: it's your spouse's birthday. You freeze just long enough for a glob of mashed potatoes to hit you, right in the middle of your face.
You wipe it away from your eyes and reach across the table to grab their shirt sleeve, pulling them across the table.
"Let's go home, darling." You whisper. "You'll get your birthday present." You smirk, mentally congratulating yourself on that smooth save.
Your spouse grins and kisses you. "I thought you'd forgotten."
"Ye of so little faith." You smile innocently before reaching up with your free hand and dump your bowl of soup over their head.
Your spouse laughs. "We'd better leave a big tip."
"You're probably right."
1331.title: You gasp and the food fight begins

info.brief_description: What happens when your better half crosses another milestone?
info.description:
Hi! Another inspiration from a member, leading to an interactive!

Thank you Starr* Rathburn (174) for telling me about your birthday! Let's see how the story you inspired turns out.

Okay, not much to describe here - it's your spouse's birthday, what happens?

Remember - whichever option you choose, the ACTUAL event is your spouse's birthday. And hey, keep it 13+, please!

Also, the attempt is to not reveal the gender of the "spouse", if possible.
(Both genders do sometimes forget spouse's birthdays, or go a-splash to celebrate them!)

I'd like it to remain lighthearted and/or romantic, too.

Okay, no more rules, I promise.
Uh ... unless they're needed at some future point!
